justification: The article explicitly describes using the Trait Ambivalence Scale to measure trait ambivalence. The scale includes various items reflecting experiences related to ambivalence, such as contradiction in thoughts and the simultaneous experience of positive and negative feelings, validating its role as an instrument for measuring this construct.

The study assessed the correspondence bias paradigm through scenarios where participants read about protagonists’ behaviors and rated the attribution of these behaviors to internal versus external factors, supporting the measurement of this attribution bias.

Participants were presented with achievement tests, given feedback, and asked to attribute success or failure to internal versus external factors. The design effectively measured the self-serving bias, a tendency to attribute positive outcomes to oneself and negative outcomes to external causes.
